definition: paternal aunt/husband's sister/husband's mother (old)/nun/for the time being (literary)

sentences.english: Stroke the cat to make it purr then click on the Cinderella.
sentences.chinese: 点击这个猫使它发声音，然后点灰姑娘。

sentences.english: They see Cinderella and Snow White.
sentences.chinese: 她们会看到灰姑娘和白雪公主。

sentences.english: Weeping, Cinderella left the room with her stepsisters' wicked laughter behind her.
sentences.chinese: 灰姑娘哭着离开房间，背后传来她继姐妹邪恶的笑声。

sentences.english: Cinderella was astonished as the mice changed into horses.
sentences.chinese: 当这些老鼠变成马匹的时候，灰姑娘感到吃惊。

sentences.english: Cinderella lives with her cruel stepmother and two selfish stepsisters, who, jealous of her beauty and sweet temper, treat her as a servant.
sentences.chinese: 灰姑娘和他刻薄的后母与自私的姐姐住在一起。

sentences.english: Why didn't the baseball catcher meet Dinderella?
sentences.chinese: 棒球队的接球员为什么没有见到灰姑娘？

sentences.english: The two sisters and the stepmother were mean to Cinderella.
sentences.chinese: 灰姑娘在他的后母和姊姊眼中是很低劣的。

sentences.english: Her stepmother and stepsisters were very horrid to Cinderella.
sentences.chinese: 她的继母和继姐妹对灰姑娘非常憎恶。

sentences.english: The Cinderallas are busy trying the Glass Shoes.
sentences.chinese: 灰姑娘们忙着试玻璃鞋。

sentences.english: Alice was dressed up to play Cinderella.
Click on Cinderella to see what happens.
sentences.chinese: 点灰姑娘看看什么发生了。
灰姑娘的玻璃鞋，有谁找到。

sentences.english: Also is the white horse prince and Poor girl the story which some people said.
sentences.chinese: 也就是有人说的白马王子和灰姑娘的故事。

sentences.english: She waves her wand and makes Cinderellas dress beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 她挥了挥魔棒，便把灰姑娘的衣服变得很漂亮了。
灰姑娘跑呀跑的，掉了一只玻璃鞋。
王子发现了灰姑娘的那只鞋。

definition: "The Ugly Duckling" by Hans Christian Andersen 安徒生[An1 tu2 sheng1]
Romeo and Juliet, 1594 tragedy by William Shakespeare 莎士比亞|莎士比亚
pinyin: Luo2 mi4 ou1 yu3 Zhu1 li4 ye4

definition: "Ms Perfect" (i.e. fair-skinned, rich and beautiful) (Internet slang)
Jane Eyre, novel by Charlotte Brontë 夏洛特·勃良特[Xia4 luo4 te4 · Bo2 liang2 te4]
heroine (of a novel or film)/main female protagonist
handsome high-powered businessman (a type of character in an eponymous genre of romantic fiction who typically has a soft spot for a girl of lower social status)
